metadata.Title: CVE-2015-2313 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Sandstorm Cap'n Proto before 0.4.1.1 and 0.5.x before 0.5.1.2, when an application invokes the totalSize method on an object reader, allows remote peers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via a crafted small message, which triggers a "tight" for loop.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2015-2312. David Renshaw discovered that the Cap'n Proto utility has a vulnerability that allows an attacker to cause denial of service via a crafted message.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2313` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

capnproto - 0.4.0-1ubuntu2.1
libcapnp-0.4.0 - 0.4.0-1ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: capnproto package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.4.0-1ubuntu2.1').
